meanings.definition: To turn forward or toward the front.
meanings.sent1: She anteverts the book on the table.
meanings.sent2: The dancer anteverts gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The robot anteverts its head to look at the audience, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His decision to antevert his focus to the future paid off in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The sun anteverts its rays over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: The act of turning forward or toward the front.
meanings.sent1: The anteverts of the ship helped it navigate through the storm.
meanings.sent2: His anteverts were always precise and efficient in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The anteverts of the clock seemed to speed up when he was having fun.
meanings.sent4: The anteverts of the story led to an exciting climax.
meanings.sent5: The anteverts of the road guided them safely to their destination.
